---
title: 'MItools vs igraph: degree calc'
author: "Vitalii Kleshchevnikov"
date: "14/07/2017"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(MItools)
  library(igraph)
})
```

## Download full human interactome as a data.table using MItools

```{r}
human_interactome = fullInteractome(taxid = "9606", database = "imex", format = "tab27", clean = F, protein_only = TRUE)
```

## Convert data table to igraph object

```{r}
human_interactome_igraph = graph_from_data_frame(d = human_interactome[, .(IDs_interactor_A, IDs_interactor_B, Publication_Identifiers, Confidence_values)], directed = F)
```

## Calculate node degree distribution using MItools

```{r}
system.time({edgelist2degree(human_interactome)})
```

## Calculate node degree distribution using igraph

```{r}
system.time({degree(human_interactome_igraph)})
```
